Text: Re FW URGENT REQUEST Cc Tracy our current forecast includes a gross bonus accrual of m for the full year Note that a portion of this amount is capitalize through our labor loading process about This is significantly below our target level for the year m and last years actual payout of m We reduced these amounts based on our lower that expected performance in Q that weve been discussing Early this year we were accruing at a maximum amount of since our forecasts looked better at the time Here s the layout of how this falls by quarter in the forecast Q Q Q forecast Q forecast Based on how Q results look we will reassess our accrual levels at that time Let me know if you have any questions Geaccone Tracy AM I only need bonus data Dont worry about Q data today Please send directly to me Thanks Original Message From Schwarzbach Stephen SentTuesday September PM ToKillen Faith Geaccone Tracy Smith Stephanie Davoli Jim Tran Agatha Lee Dana West Terry SubjectURGENT REQUEST Hello everyone Management has begun to look toward the th quarter and is requesting certain information from each business unit I need to know by am Wednesday a Total bonus accrual for b Amount of bonus accrual that is or will be accrued YTD through September c Amount remaining to be accrued in th Qtr Additionally each CAO has been asked to compile a list of potential hurdleschallengescleanup items for the th Qtr that will be discussed at an offsite this week You may want to touch base with them and make sure they are aware of this and come prepared I have sent a reminder message to them today also Thanks Steve with the exception of EGEP Jim call me if you want to discuss PS Faith and Tracy Im assuming you guys will coordinate for wholesale and stans world respectively If youd like me to contact any group directly let me know

Re FW URGENT REQUESTTracy FYI I already provided a list of Q challengeshurdles to Rod a couple of days ago Let me know if you need a copy Geaccone Tracy AM I only need bonus data Dont worry about Q data today Please send directly to me Thanks Original Message From Schwarzbach Stephen SentTuesday September PM ToKillen Faith Geaccone Tracy Smith Stephanie Davoli Jim Tran Agatha Lee Dana West Terry SubjectURGENT REQUEST Hello everyone Management has begun to look toward the th quarter and is requesting certain information from each business unit I need to know by am Wednesday a Total bonus accrual for b Amount of bonus accrual that is or will be accrued YTD through September c Amount remaining to be accrued in th Qtr Additionally each CAO has been asked to compile a list of potential hurdleschallengescleanup items for the th Qtr that will be discussed at an offsite this week You may want to touch base with them and make sure they are aware of this and come prepared I have sent a reminder message to them today also Thanks Steve with the exception of EGEP Jim call me if you want to discuss PS Faith and Tracy Im assuming you guys will coordinate for wholesale and stans world respectively If youd like me to contact any group directly let me know

Q Adjustments AACo Review Cc Rod please forward this note to Mark Lindsey ASAP I cant find his name on our email address book and Ive had trouble with sending him things in the past Attached is a file that includes unusual accounting adjustments andor implementation adjustments were proposing as a result of our new rate case order These adjustments total m IBIT and m Net Income for Q Forecasted results for Q weve been sending to you including our rd Current Estimate include these adjustments Accordingly not getting AACo concurence on any of these issues will have a negative impact on PGGs Q results For entries affecting PGH PVC see tab we need to make sure Enron Corp is supportive of our treatment This is because although AACo Portland will be reviewing our records and our reasons for the adjustments they will likely pass on the AACo Houston any of these items they may question This is because their primary focus is PGE earnings not PVC or PGH since we dont report these companies out any place publicly on a standalone basis Weve passed along the Merger MOU proposal to AACo Portland already since it has ties to our rate order and theyre thinking about it but were waiting to hear back from you that the other three items on the list are support by you then well pass them on to AACo Portland for review Please respond back by next Monday Sept th to allow us appropriate time to get them reviewed by AACo All the items on the PGE tab have been explained to AACo Portland and were hoping to get their position on these adjustments by next Monday Sept We feel we have good justification for all the adjustments but some are more of a stretch than others when projecting whether or not AACo will approve them Please call if you have any questions thanks

Fwd PGG Best Case ForecastRodStan Bob Butts requested an update on a best case scenerio for PGG earnings for see attached Were discussing this with Bob today Please call if you have questions about this info Original Message Date pm Friday From Kirk Stevens To Bob Butts CC DARRINGTON OUTAMA Jim Piro Subject PGG Best Case Forecast Bob per your conversations with Jim Piro attached is a best case forecast of PGG earnings for if net variable power costs were to improve by standard deviations Ill give you a call to see if you can discuss this today or set up a time to discuss on Monday Note that just as we could overperform to this level changes in price curves load changes or power plant operations could result in earnings worse than our current estimate numbers Volitilitys the word Also attached are some sensitivities for Q earnings that were dealing with that may reduce our current forecast or offset potential benefits of us overperforming on net variable power costs

Re FW Q forecastRod our last forecast showed the catchup for Q allocations spread over Q thru Q Instead we recorded the entire catchup for Q in May all Q No difference to the full year look just a change in shaping Hayslett Rod AM I thought the last forecast we reviewed had the catch up of the allocations included Original Message From Piro Jim Sent Wednesday June PM To Horton Stanley Cc Hayslett Rod Stevens Kirk Piro Jim FOWLER PEGGY Subject Q forecast Attached is a spreadsheet that compares our original plan budget plus overview to our forecast for the nd quarter with actuals for April and May and last months forecast for June We are in the process of completing our May closing but the IBIT number for May is complete The June forecast was prepared last month and we are now in the process of updating our forecast of power cost and IBIT for June We should complete that next week Curves in the west continue to come down which will potentially reduce our IBIT for June but I will know more next week The spreadsheet shows million IBIT compared to what I provided you early this week of million The primary difference is power cost and our view that given the current movement in wholesale prices from May that power cost could rise by an additional million from that level We are currently in the dead band zone for the PCA so any change in power cost go right to IBIT There is one other issue related to power cost concerning our need to potentially increase our reserves for the California receivables AA continues to push us on this issue to increase the amount of reserves If we have a good June we might want to increase our reserves however this is something we will talk with Bob Butz about early next month when June results are available Please call if you would like to discuss this further We will have a better look at June next week once the updated forecast is completed

Q EarningsRod just an FYI we just flashed our results to Corp for the quarter and we came in at IBIT of m and net income of m AACo is currently reviewing our work so we hope nothing material jumps out at them

Q Earnings PGG Cc Rod per your request attached is an analysis to use in your discussion tomorrow with Stan Horton regarding PGGs expected financial results for Q More specifically I laid out a plan as to how we might cover our current overview gap of m IBIT from where our latest forecast came out As you will see several of these items will need to get AACo buyin items noted as either Accouting Changes or Changes in Management Position I think we have a good case for all of these but we still need to go through the process with them at the appropriate time In addition Ive note Other RisksOpportunities for the quarter that could have significant impacts on our ultimate results We will keep an eye on these and manage them as appropriate Well also try to keep you updated on these as we progress through the Qtr Let me know if you have any questions

RE PGE Power Costs Cc Gay heres the story and some numbers for the Q comparison Please remember the context of our phone conversion this morning when looking at this Hopefully this helps Investor Relations put the story together for the Earnings Release Power Cost Adjustment We now expect to have an amount collectable from customers to record all Q of m Since we were basically at the deadband level at the end of Q we end up eating our way through the deadband and up into the collection band all in Q On a stand alone basis we will incur about m of net variable power costs Q that we wont have any revenues for but remember to keep this in context for the entire month period The following shows how this is calculated Projected Net Variable Power Costs m Baseline for PCA m Difference Subject to PCA Collection Deadband m no collection band m collect m no collection band m collect m no collection The bands above m Collections m No Collection PGE eats m Again without the PCA mechanism and no other price increase between and PGE would be m worse off As we discussed before pulling our request for a rate increase to be effective which was replaced with the PCA mechanism the latest amount being offered up by our PUC would have been around a m increase for the month period although the evidence was quickly moving towards no need for an increase so we probably wouldnt have got the rate increase and without a PCA would have been worse off today Quarter to Quarter Comparison Margins As we discussed things were looking really good for us through Q but price caps and other factors in late Qearly Q really dropped the price we could sell our excess power for and accordingly has dropped our margins In addition a slowing economy and customer energy efficiency measures have resulted in significant reductions in our retail revenues compared to last year Another point on the this yearlast year quarter to quarter comparisons is that we went into Q with length purchased at fairly lowreasonable costs over the prior year or so In Q wholesale sales prices increased dramatically California market so we made tremendous margins above normal Going into Q much of the power we purchased was at higher prices than the previous year because of the higher wholesale power market operating over the past year When price caps and other events dropped the bottom out of the wholesale power prices our margins on our power lenght dropped dramatically The PCA only picks up a power of this increase in net variable power costs as outlined above Also remember that we have a regulatory obligation to serve our customers so we have to go into a month with length in order to ensure we can handle any potential load spikes or unplanned plant outages Any excess power is sold in the wholesale market in the dayahead or realtime markets Big story price caps and lower retail revenues have really hurt us year to year but our new rate case effective should get us back on track Gross Margin Comparisons Based on our latest forecast heres a breakdown of our gross margins on a year to year comparison for Q This gives you a high level look at the impact the above events have had on our margins year to year m decrease in gross margin Q Q Retail Revenues m m Wholesale Revenues m m Other Revenues m m Variable Power Costs m m Gross Margin m m Let me know if you have questions Mayeux Gay Gay NRONnet AM I will try again Mine shows an attachment Look at the very bottom of the email Thanks Gay Mayeux Vice President Investor Relations Enron Corp Smith Street EB a Houston Texas Phone Cell Fax email Original Message From Kirk Stevens mailto Sent Tuesday September PM To Mayeux Gay Subject Re PGE Power Costs Gay there wasnt an attachment Mayeux Gay Gay NRONnet PM Attached is my attempt to summarize the PGE power cost issue Please call me to discuss I have no pride of authorship just want to make sure it is simple as possible while still being correct I will be here until relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you

Quarter to Quarter Variance Explanations Plan vs ActualRod attached is the variance analysis Rick Causey requested at our meeting in Portland Please take a look at it and let me know when youre ready to discuss it Wed like your input before passing it along to Rick thanks

Portland General Quarterly Comparisons Plan vs Actuals Cc Rick in our meeting in Portland on March th you requested a reconciliation of Quarterly results for our Plan vs Actual results Attached is this comparison that has been reviewed by Jim Piro and Rod Hayslett If you have any questions or would like to discuss this let me know and Ill set up a conference call with you Jim Piro and myself to go through this Thanks Rick
